title: Question 20
prompt: If in the year 2050, the mean center of the U.S. population moved to the western-most end of Kentucky, which of the following could be true?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The mean, or average, center of population is closer to areas where the population is higher. The farther east the mean center of population is, the higher the population in the east is compared to the population in the west. The map shows a consistent movement of the population towards the west and towards the south over time.

If the mean center of population in 2050 were in Kentucky, the population would still be, generally, moving toward the south, but there would be a higher concentration of population in the east than in 2000. This could be explained if the population in the east increased faster than the population in the west.
